intro: Pterocaulon pompilianum, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many plants with milky sap. The plant typically grows as a shrub with woody stems and opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small, clustered in umbels, and range in color from white to pink. The plant is known for its latex, which is toxic and can cause skin irritation.
